Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For more information about the COM object, see

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese and Latin text for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

member this.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndDigit : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese text and numbers for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment Alignment { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a constant that represents the alignment for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: Some of the WdParagraphAlignment constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the value (in characters) for a first-line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CloseUp() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes any spacing before the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int CollapsedByDefault { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CollapsedByDefault : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets whether the specified paragraph format is collapsed by default. Read-write Integer (int in C#).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DisableLineHeightGrid { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DisableLineHeightGrid : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word aligns characters in the specified paragraphs to the line grid when a set number of lines per page is specified.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it's set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Duplicate As ParagraphFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a read-only object that represents the paragraph formatting of the specified paragraph.

remarks.para: You can use the Duplicate property to pick up the settings of all the properties of a duplicated ParagraphFormat object. You can assign the object returned by the Duplicate property to another object of the same type to apply those settings all at once. Before assigning the duplicate object to another object, you can change any of the properties of the duplicate object without affecting the original.

member this.FarEastLineBreakControl : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word applies East Asian line-breaking rules to the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it's set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

member this.FirstLineIndent : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the value (in points) for a first line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word changes punctuation symbols at the beginning of a line to half-width characters for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

member this.Hyphenation : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the specified paragraphs are included in automatic hyphenation. False if the specified paragraphs are to be excluded from automatic hyphenation. Can be True, False or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IndentCharWidth([in]int16 Count) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Short. The number of characters by which the specified paragraphs are to be indented.
Docs.summary: Indents one or more paragraphs by a specified number of characters.

remarks.para: Using this method is equivalent to clicking the Increase Indent button on the Formatting toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IndentFirstLineCharWidth([in]int16 Count) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Short. The number of characters by which the first line of each specified paragraph is to be indented.
Docs.summary: Indents the first line of one or more paragraphs by a specified number of characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int KeepTogether { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.KeepTogether : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if all lines in the specified paragraphs remain on the same page when Microsoft Word repaginates the document. Can be True, False, or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int KeepWithNext { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.KeepWithNext : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the specified paragraph remains on the same page as the paragraph that follows it when Microsoft Word repaginates the document. Can be True, False, or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LeftIndent { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.LeftIndent : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the left indent value (in points) for the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LineSpacing { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.LineSpacing : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the line spacing (in points) for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: The LineSpacing property can be set after the property have been set to:
wdLineSpaceAtLeast - the line spacing can be greater than or equal to, but never less than, the specified LineSpacing value.
wdLineSpaceExactly - the line spacing never changes from the specified LineSpacing value, even if a larger font is used within the paragraph.
wdLineSpaceMultiple - a LineSpacing property value must be specified, in points.
Use the method to convert a number of lines to the corresponding value in points. For example, LinesToPoints(2) returns the value 24.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing LineSpacingRule { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the line spacing for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: can be one of the following WdLineSpacing constants: wdLineSpace1pt5, wdLineSpaceAtLeast, wdLineSpaceDouble, wdLineSpaceExactly, wdLineSpaceMultiple, or wdLineSpaceSingle.
To set the line spacing to an exact number of points or to a multiple number of lines, you must also set the property.

Docs.summary: True if line numbers are repressed for the specified paragraphs. Can be True, False, or wdUndefined.

remarks.para: Use the property to set line numbers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OpenOrCloseUp() runtime managed

Docs.summary: If spacing before the specified paragraphs is 0 (zero), this method sets spacing to 12 points. If spacing before the paragraphs is greater than 0 (zero), this method sets spacing to 0 (zero).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OpenUp() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sets spacing before the specified paragraphs to 12 points.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel OutlineLevel { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the outline level for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: If a paragraph has a heading style applied to it (Heading 1 through Heading 9), the outline level is the same as the heading style and cannot be changed.
Outline levels are visible only in outline view or the document map pane.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PageBreakBefore { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.PageBreakBefore : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if a page break is forced before the specified paragraphs. Can be True, False, or wdUndefined.

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdReadingOrder ReadingOrder { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdReadingOrder get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdReadingOrder value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the reading order of the specified paragraphs without changing their alignment.

remarks.para: Use the , , , and methods to change the paragraph alignment along with the reading order.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes manual paragraph formatting (formatting not applied using a style). For example, if you manually right align a paragraph and the underlying style has a different alignment, the Reset method changes the alignment to match the formatting of the underlying style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float RightIndent { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.RightIndent : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the right indent (in points) for the specified paragraphs.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ Shading { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that refers to the shading formatting for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space1() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Single-spaces the specified paragraphs. The exact spacing is determined by the font size of the largest characters in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space15() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Formats the specified paragraphs with 1.5-line spacing. The exact spacing is determined by adding 6 points to the font size of the largest character in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space2() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Double-spaces the specified paragraphs. The exact spacing is determined by adding 12 points to the font size of the largest character in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float SpaceAfter { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.SpaceAfter : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of spacing (in points) after the specified paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SpaceAfterAuto { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.SpaceAfterAuto : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word automatically sets the amount of spacing after the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it's set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.
When you open an HTML document without cascading style sheets, Word automatically sets the SpaceAfterAuto property to True to render the paragraph spacing exactly as it would appear in a Web browser.
If SpaceAfterAuto is set to True, the property is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float SpaceBefore { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.SpaceBefore : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the spacing (in points) before the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SpaceBeforeAuto { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.SpaceBeforeAuto : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word automatically sets the amount of spacing before the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it's set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

When you open an HTML document without cascading style sheets, Word automatically sets the SpaceBeforeAuto property to True to render the paragraph spacing exactly as it would appear in a Web browser.
If SpaceBeforeAuto is set to True, the property is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Style { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Style : obj with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style for the specified object.

remarks.para: To set this property, specify the local name of the style, an integer, a constant, or an object that represents the style.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TabHangingIndent([in]int16 Count) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Short. The number of tab stops to indent (if positive) or the number of tab stops to remove from the indent (if negative).
Docs.summary: Sets a hanging indent to a specified number of tab stops.

remarks.para: This method can be used to remove tab stops from a hanging indent if the value of is a negative number.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TabIndent([in]int16 Count) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Short. The number of tab stops to indent (if positive) or the number of tab stops to remove from the indent (if negative).
Docs.summary: Sets the left indent for the specified paragraphs to a specified number of tab stops.

remarks.para: This method can also be used to remove the indent if the value of is a negative number.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int WidowControl { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.WidowControl : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the first and last lines in the specified paragraph remain on the same page as the rest of the paragraph when Word repaginates the document. Can be True, False or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int WordWrap { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.WordWrap : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word wraps Latin text in the middle of a word in the specified paragraphs or text frames.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs or text frames.
This usage may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.
